DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the percentage of infiltration by eosinophils in a sample or specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._Granular leukocytes with a nucleus that usually has two lobes connected by a slender thread of chromatin, and cytoplasm containing coarse, round granules that are uniform in size and stainable by eosin.:The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI):A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._A condition in which the number of eosinophils (a type of white blood cell) in the blood is greatly increased. Eosinophilia is often a response to infection or allergens (substances that cause an allergic response).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the number of eosinophils (a type of white blood cell) in the blood is greatly increased. Eosinophilia is often a response to infection or allergens (substances that cause an allergic response).

Concepts.definition: Abnormal high level of eosinophils in the blood.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value as a percentage of 100.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: v1.1 of VD replaces v1.0 to increase overall field length and include 2 decimal places. 1.14.2016.dmr

DataElement.changeDescription: New VD version to extend max length and add decimal. Modified definition to remove tumor term. mc 9/9/16
